title: Properties as attributes on Project element
body:
Hey friends, 
With all the great strides that are happening with the *proj format, wouldn't it be neat if you could set property values as attributes on the root project element?

f.e, before:

```
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>Exe</OutputType>
    <TargetFramework>netcoreapp1.0</TargetFramework>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```

after

`<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk" OutputType="Exe" TargetFramework="netcoreapp1.0"/>`

This would only be a short hand and most people would set most of their properties the old way, but it would get some of those properties you always set out of the way. 

In my mind this would be for properties only, not Items, so the names would not be ambiguous in that sense. They'd then be pre processed into regular property groups (if I remember correctly there is a preprosessor step that transforms the sdk property already correct?)

What do you think?

nodes.body:
ping? 
Obviously this would be a post vs2017 change (unless its super easy) but I think it would be very useful.

I'd love to take a stab at it myself but i'm not quite sure where to start, so if you'd have any pointers i'd be very grateful :)
So now that 2017 has shipped, will you consider this for the 2.0 timeframe? I think it would be very handy

IMHO, This is too much. Most of the time, especially for real world projects, you would most certainly have more than 10 lines of properties/items definitions.

Is there any scenario where you think, this is useful?
